body:
Comment 7: 
In your most recent run, the syscall test passed.

There is no need to give us the syscall.test program.  What we need to find out is why
it was failing on your system.  But I see that in the most recent run, it didn't fail. 
I don't know why it failed before and I don't why it succeeded now.  What I was
suggesting is that you run syscall.test, such that it fails, and then run it under
strace to see why it fails.

The runtime/pprof test failures are uninteresting, they are due to qemu.  Ignore those.
